EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.00}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Gas on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Gas on the x-axis is {0.94}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Production on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Production on the y-axis is {0.93}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Coal on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Coal on the x-axis is {0.48}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Infrastructure or the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Prices?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Nuclear} and {Infrastructure} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Transmission and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Renewables} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Coal and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Waste Management and Policy?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Coal} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.16 to 0.31?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Exploration, Emissions), (Gas, Emissions), (Coal, Investment), (Exploration, Investment), (Transmission, Policy), (Waste Management, Prices), (Exploration, Production), (Gas, Production), (Renewables, Technology)}.
